sentences.sContent: So too the stories of Moses and of Samson have Sumerian and Babylonian parallels.
sentences.sContent_eng: So too the stories of Moses and of Samson have Sumerian and Babylonian parallels.
sentences.sCn: 同样，关于摩西和参孙的传说在苏美尔和巴比伦也有相似的版本。

sentences.sContent: The early Babylonian's most popular resolution was to return borrowed farm equipment.
sentences.sContent_eng: The early Babylonian's most popular resolution was to return borrowed farm equipment.
sentences.sCn: 早期巴比伦人最普遍的计划是归还借来的耕种工具。

sentences.sContent: In the years around 2000 BC, the Babylonian New Year began with the first New Moon (actually the first visible crescent) after the Vernal Equinox (first day of spring).
sentences.sContent_eng: In the years around 2000 BC, the Babylonian New Year began with the first New Moon (actually the first visible crescent) after the Vernal Equinox (first day of spring).
sentences.sCn: 大约在公元前2000年，巴比伦的新年随着春分（春天的第一天）之后的第一个新月（实际上第一个看得见的新月）开始了。

trans.tranOther: of, relating to, or characteristic of ancient Babylon or Babylonia, its people, or their language
an inhabitant of ancient Babylon or Babylonia
